repositories.name: hlb-gpt
repositories.description: Minimalistic, extremely fast, and hackable researcher's toolbench for GPT models in 307 lines of code. Reaches <3.8 validation loss on wikitext-103 on a single A100 in <100 seconds. Scales to larger models with one parameter change (feature currently in alpha).

tinygrad/tinygrad.summary: Recent activities in the tinygrad repository have focused on enhancements and fixes to the deep learning framework, including improvements to the reshape function, the addition of a buf_uop_view function, and the resolution of a failed test case. Multiple pull requests have been submitted to address issues with gradients and the API, showcasing the ongoing effort to refine and expand the framework's capabilities.

profile_summary:
George Hotz is a highly accomplished developer with a strong technical foundation in languages such as Python, C, and C++. With a large following of over 43,800 like-minded professionals, he has demonstrated exceptional abilities in creating innovative, high-impact projects that contribute to the growth of the developer community. His portfolio boasts an impressive collection of 96 public repositories, a testament to his dedication to constant learning and improvement in the field of software development.

As a visionary developer, George aims to push the boundaries of what is possible in the world of technology. His mantra, "We will commoditize the petaflop," reflects his passion for harnessing the power of computing and making it more accessible to the masses. With his technical expertise and collaborative spirit, he continues to drive progress in the field, inspiring fellow developers and leaving a lasting impact on the world of technology.
